math_problem.A3773: Find all functions   $ f:Z\to Z$ with the following property: if  $x+y+z=0$, then $f(x)+f(y)+f(z)=xyz.$ Instead of finding all integer-valued functions on the integers satisfying the given functional equation, simply find $k = f(0) + 1$, where $f(0)$ is the value at zero for any such function.

math_problem.A3812: How many integers $n>1$ are there such that $n$ divides $x^{13}-x$ for every positive integer $x$?

A3773: Mathematics -> Algebra -> Abstract Algebra -> Group Theory

A3812: Mathematics -> Algebra -> Abstract Algebra -> Field Theory
